Overview. Ants in flower pots generally do not cause any harm, but they are quite the nuisance. They may even be nesting in your flower pot, giving you a serious ant problem in your home. Killing ants in flower pots is possible, but it may take several treatments if you do not just repot the plant. Step 1. Place an ant bait in the flower pot. The ants will take the bait back to their nest (which may be in the flower pot) and kill the colony. Alternatively, make your own bait by mixing 1 part powdered boric acid for every 50 to 100 parts of bait material, such as peanut butter, condensed milk or bacon grease.

Ant Traps. Use baited ant traps to capture and kill ants in pots. Make the bait by dissolving 1 teaspoon of boric acid and 6 tablespoons of sugar in two cups of water. The sugar attracts the ants, and the boric acid kills them.
